Originally posted by at Help Us Support Planned Parenthood
Join us in standing up for reproductive health and education. Planned Parenthood, the organization that delivers reproductive health care, sex education and information to millions of people worldwide, has come under fire in the U.S. lately, with many politicians on both state and federal level seeking to end funding (and in a few cases succeeding). During the month of May, you can send a specially designed Planned Parenthood vgift to your friends to help support this cause. (And if you need someone to send it to, is always happy to receive gifts!) There are three variations ($1, $5 and $10) for you to choose from, but they'd all look good on your profile when your friends know that you stand by something so important.
                    
Thank you all for your help in our support for Planned Parenthood. This promotion ends June 1, 2012; LiveJournal is not affiliated with Parent Parenthood. For more information about Planned Parenthood, please visit: http://www.plannedparenthood.org/ -The LiveJournal Team (If you'd like to help spread the word that we're raising funds for Planned Parenthood, you can crosspost this entry in your own journal or community by using the repost button below!)

May as well say hello to keep up my once per year posting record. Woo!

The presence of you and your movie knowledge is humbly requested. Stop by and guess which movies these quotes are from. I know y'all will know some of these. Good times, I promise. Come and show off your badass selves!

My Life So Far by Jane Fonda (4/5) (more commentary here once blogger stops acting up.) And yes, I'm two books behind already if I'm going to swing another 50 this year. I'm being more selective at the moment so we'll see how it goes.

You're The Catcher in the Rye!
by J.D. Salinger
You are surrounded by phonies, and boy are you sick of them! In an ongoing struggle to search for a land without phonies, you end up running away from everything, from school to consequences. In this process, you reveal that many people in your life have suffered torments and all you really want to do is catch them as they fall. Perhaps using a baseball mitt. Your biggest fans are infamous psychotics.
 Take the Book Quiz at the Blue Pyramid.

Addictive spinning things. My best score is 1761. And this one, I bet boo and sarooo will enjoy: How fast can you type the alphabet? Not very fast by the looks of the high scores, but I consider my 5.7084262 respectable. It's the last 5 or so letters that hang me up.

"Magic Worlds of Fantasy" by David Douglas Duncan (++) (If you follow the link, click the book cover for more images.) Book shows the work of 4 amateur artists, each inspired by their own fantasy world. Cool stuff.

49. "Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire" by J.K. Rowling (/)

I have mixed feelings.  Overrated is the word that generally comes to mind.  I enjoyed the book but because I already like these characters.  As a single book, there are lots of things it could've done without.  I'll reserve judgment on those things until the movies are done, and if I actually read the rest.

Clarified a few things from the movie which satisfied my curiousity and way beyond.

I find myself thinking Hogwarts is low on extra-curriculars.

"Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban" by J.K. Rowling (+)

The first I've read of the series.  I prefer the punch of the movie to the slap of the book, but I found it an enjoyable read overall.  Mainly I was catching up on some characters after seeing the latest movie.  Just started the 4th book to help me keep all the new characters straight and to see what was cut for time.

You scored as Mermaid. Mermaid: Mermaids are also known as Sirens. These creatures were beautiful women who tricked sailors into becoming completely entranced by their haunting voices and found death soon after. Not all stories of Mermaids are about gentle loving sea people. They are mystical, magical, and extremely dangerous. They have a way about them that brings anyone they are around to seem enchanted. They are very mysterious creatures and to meet one... Would mean certain Death. Let the song of the Sea fill your soul, for you are a Mermaid.

"Little Girl Lost" by Drew Barrymore with Todd Gold (+)

Todd isn't a contributing writer in the usual sense.  It's more you read what Drew wrote and then there's a font and margin shift when he's filling in background and creating transitions.  It works some places better than others.  When it's more him than him relating things her mom said, I don't much care for it.  But then he was a staff correspondent for People magazine so what can you expect.

Her story is really interesting.  The book came out when she was 15 and mainly covers her descent to alcoholism and drug addiction and then rehab from ages 9 to 14.  Pretty amazing she pulled her life back together.

The Movie Of Your Life Is Film Noir
So what if you're a little nihilistic at times? Life with meaning is highly over-rated. Your best movie matches: Sin City, L. A. Confidential, Blade Runner
If Your Life Was a Movie, What Genre Would It Be?
I'm not sure about the film choices, but the sentiment seems fair.

You are Cmdr. William Riker, you lady-killer you!

Which Star Trek: TNG character are you?
brought to you by Quizilla

44. "A Man Without a Country" by Kurt Vonnegut (++)

What can I say?  Though much of the outlook is depressing, I still found in myself a resounding YES because I see the world that way too.  It's a quick read- I polished it off in one evening.  I may read it again before I return it.

A brave and loyal associate full of optimism, you remain true to your friends and their efforts, to whatever end.
But in the end, it's only a passing thing, this shadow. Even darkness must pass. A new day will come. And when the sun shines it will shine out the clearer.

41. "The Diamond Lane" by Karen Karbo (+)

Hard to believe yet accurate depiction of life in Hollywood I've come across.  A number of things made me laugh out loud.  Must remember to send this to my doc bud and her screenwriting beau for xmas.

Ok, I was so amused by my results to this meme from <lj user="beckastar">, I'm also posting my results here:

The game is: Put your musical device or software of choice on random, then ask it each question before going to the next song. I did not cheat.  [I did not cheat either]

What do you think of me, little iPod? Battle of Evermore - The Lovemongers

Will I have a happy life? NIght and Day - Ella Fitzgerald

What do my friends really think of me?  The Sacrifice - Michael Nyman

Do people secretly lust after me? De Tout Ton Coeur- Anouar Brahem

How can I make myself happy? Can't Not - Alanis Morissette

What should I do with my life? Rocky Raccoon -The Beatles

Why must life be so full of pain? I'm goin' home - Hootie and the Blowfish

How can I maximize my pleasure during sex? Cowboy take me away -The Dixie Chicks

Will I ever have children? Fette's Vette- MC Chris  

Will I die happy?  Under the Milky Way - The Church

Can you give me some advice? Oh L'amour - Erasure

What do you think happiness is? Naked Eye - Luscious Jackson

What's my favorite fetish? Go Your Own Way - Fleetwood Mac
The Last Picture Show by Larry McMurtry (++) really rather good

You scored as Aramis. You are Aramis, the Musketeer priest. Two natures war within you: one full of high-minded ideals and the other a sensualist. Your love life is an art form, and you are a Romantic who places great importance on the perfect date. Sometimes you manipulate people and events a little too much, but your heart is good nevertheless.

button your top button and wear a damn coat and tie for your next address.  i'm all for casual fridays, but c'mon.  show us and your office some respect.
The Art of War by Sun Tzu (/) more commentary at ttat

all that comes to mind is: fuck.

well that and I guess we'll get to see just how much worse things can get.
Harry Potter Personality Quiz by Pirate Monkeys Inc.
37. Deep South by Nevada Barr (/) /'ed not for lack of quality, because certain aspects were overly familiar to my own work past, and that's just not what I was hoping for when I picked it up.
36. On Bullshit by Harry G. Frankfurt (/) More commentary here.

Telling Lies: Clues to deceit in the marketplace, politics, and marriage by Paul Ekman (+) Basically even if you know what to look for, it's still a complicated endeavor, but I better understand some of my reactions to/fear of being falsely accused. Concealment (aka omission) is also categorized as lying. Amen.

33. What Should I Do With My Life? by Po Bronson (++) stories of how 50-some people answered that q. 34. "Exterminate all the Brutes" by Sven Lindqvist, translated from the Swedish by Joan Tate (++) Usually 2 +s is an indication of how likely I am to reread something or buy it. In this case, I think most everyone should read this at least once. If I was inexplicably forced to teach Heart of Darkness, I would have my students read this book too. The author traces that line of Conrad's in European history while incorporating his own travels in Africa and discussing origins of racism and genocide.

it's amazing how much i miss writing when i'm less able to do it.  even if it's not deep or much, the writing- I need it!

BG- some exercise which felt great for my shoulders started putting strain on my forearms causing me less dexterity.  As someone who usually types close to my thought speed, it's mostly too much for my patience.  So, stopped that exercise and left forearm is improving though right is still not up to snuff.  But! now my shoulders are fuckingagonizers.   Not too bad during day but are pain trhogh night.  once i'm finally out tylenol pm keeps me out a few hours but then it's pain, wakeup, toss and turn, try to be calm, release pain, drift off, then wake up again.  I'm sleeping even later than usual since my sleep is so disrupted.  Grrr.  hopefully with some trial and error I will find the right stretch to ease them out of this. 

grtrrr.

MTV's re-playing concert footage from last week's live 8 concert sans annoying dj commentary.  Makes for pleasant concert footage viewing.  Just got some acts playing in Tokyo.

must jet
